gurmukhi: cMdR pRBw sm jw muK hY qn kMcn so Aiq suMdr nwrI ] kY giH mwn kY nId geI ik koaU aunmwn kI bwq ibcwrI ]678]
transliteration: Channdra Prabhaa Sam Jaa Moukh Hai Tan Kanchanndso At(i) Soundar Ndaree|| Kai Grih Maan Kai Need Gadki Ko( i)  Ounmaan Kibaat Bichdaree||678||
translation: Radha, whose face is like the moon and whose body is like gold and who is extremely charming has either gone to her home under the impact of sleep or because of some pride and thinking about it, she has left.678.

gurmukhi: ib`j Ctw ijh nwm sKI ko hY soaU sKI jdurwie bulweI ] AMg pRBw ijh kMcn sI ijh qy muK cMd Ctw Cib pweI ]
transliteration: Bijj Chhataa Jih Naam Sakhiko Hai Sooo Sakhijaduraae Bulaaee|| An Prabhaa Jih Kanchanndsijih Te Moukh Channd Chhataa Chhab(i) Paaee||
translation: Krishna called the young damsel named Vidhuchhata; her body glistened like gold and the glory of her face was like moon;

gurmukhi: qw sMg AYsy khXo hirjU sun qUM biRKBwn suqw pih jweI ] pwien pY ibnqIAn kY Aiq hyq ky Bwv so ilAwau mnweI ]679]
transliteration: Taa San Aise Kahyo Har(i)joo Soun Toon Brikhbhaan Soutaa Pah(i) Jaaee|| Paain Pai Binteeaan Kai At(i) Het Ke Bhaav So Liaao Manaaee||679||
translation: Krishna called her and said, “You go to Radha and falling at her feet request her and persuade her to come.”679.

gurmukhi: jdurwie kI so sun kY bqIAw biRKBwn suqw joaU bwl BlI hY ] rUp mno sm suMdr mYn ky mwnhu suMdr kMj clI hY ]
transliteration: Jaduraae Kiso Soun Kai Bateeaa Brikhbhaan Soutaa Jooo Baal Bhalihai|| Roop Mano Sam Soundar Main Ke Maanoh Soundar Kanj Chalihai||
translation: Listening to the words of Krishna, the king of Yadavas, the young damsel obeying him, started towards Radha, who is charming like the god of love and lotus,

gurmukhi: qwky mnwieby kwj clI hir ko Pun Awies pwie AlI hY ] XO aupjI ijX mY aupmw kr qy ckeI mno CUt clI hY ]680]
transliteration: Taake Manaahe Kaaj Chalihar(i) Ko Phoun Aaees Paae Alihai|| Yaoun Oupjijiya Mai Oupmaa Kar Te Chakaimano Chhodht Chalihai||680||
translation: In order to persuade her; she moved like a disc slipping from the hand.680.

gurmukhi: ib`j Ctw ijh nwm sKI ko soaU biRKBwn suqw pih AweI ] Awie kY suMdr AYsy khXo sun qUM rI qRIXw nwQ bulweI ]
transliteration: Bijj Chhataa Jih Naam Sakhiko Sooo Brikhbhaan Soutaa Pah(i) Aaee|| Ooe Kai Soundar Aise Kahyo Soun Toon Ritreeyaa Brij Naath Bulaaee||
translation: The damsel named Vidhuchhata came to Radha and said, “O friend! Krishna, the Lord of Braja has called you.”;

gurmukhi: ko biRjnwQ khXo biRj nwr su ko knReIXw khXo kaun knRweI ] Kylhu qwhI qiRXw sMg lwlrI ko ijh ky sMg pRIq lgweI ]681]
transliteration: Ko Brijnaath Kahyo Brij Naar Su Ko Kanhaeeyaa Kahyo Kaoun Kanhaaee|| Kheloh Taahitriyaa San Laalariko Jih Ke San Preet Lagadee||681||
translation: Radha said, “Who is this Lord of Braja?” Then the damsel said, “He is the same, who is also called Kanhaiya;” then Radha said, “Who is this Kanhaiya!” Now Vidyuchhata said; “ He is same, with whom, you have been absorbed in amorous sport and whom all the

gurmukhi: sjnI nMd lwl bulwvq hY Apny mn mY hT rMc n kIjY ] AweI hY hau cil kY qum pY iqh qy su khXo Ab mwn hI lIjY ]
transliteration: Sajninand Laal Bulaavat Hai Apne Man Mai Hath Ranch Na Keejai|| Ooihai Hau Chal(i) Kai Toum Pai Tih Te Su Kahyo Ab Maan Hileejai||
translation: “O friend! do not persist a little in your mind, the son of Nand is calling you; I have come to you only for this purpose; therefore, comply with my saying;

gurmukhi: byg clo jdurwie ky pws kCU qumro ieh qy nhI CIjY ] qwhI qy bwq kho qum so suK Awpn lY suK Aaurn dIjY ]682]
transliteration: Beg Chalo Jaduraae Ke Paas Kachhodh Toumro Eh Te Nahinahichheejai|| Taahite Baat Kaho Toum So Soukh Aapan Lai Soukh Auran Deejai||682||
translation: “You go to Krishna immediately, you will not lose anything by this; therefore I am telling you to be in the state of happiness yourself and impart happiness to others.682.

gurmukhi: qw qy kro nhI mwn sKI auT byg clo isK mwn hmwrI ] murlI ijh kwnH bjwvq hY bhsY qh gÍwrn suMdr gwrI ]
transliteration: Taa Te Daro Nahimaan Sakhiouth Beg Chalo Sikh Maan Hamdaree|| Murlijih Kaahn Bajaavat Hai Bahsai Tah Gvaaran Soundar Gdaree||
translation: “O friend! do not be too proud and follow my advice to go the place where Krishna is playing on his flute and listening to the coquettish abuses of the gopis,
